column3: also known as Takestan (Persian: تاكستان‎ Tâkestân)
column4: is a city and capital of Takestan County
column6: Iran. At the 2011 census its population was 120
column7: 907. Takestan has a railway station on the Teheran-Tabriz line.  The name Takestan literally means "vineyard".

column1: Most of the population of Takestan belong to the Tat ethnic group and speak the Tati language. Takestan is the largest Tat-populated city in the world.

column2: alternatively known as Pir-e Takestan and Imamzadeh Pir
column4: domed building dating from the Seljuq-era 11th century and has since been restored. Only little of the original ornamental decorations remains.

column2: Sylvia A. (1972). Persia: An Archaeological Guide. London: Faber and Faber Limited. ISBN 0-571-09305-1
